alert.note: Alert for Albany (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 07 at 12:40PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and eastern New York, including the following counties, in east central New York, Albany, Saratoga, Schenectady, Schoharie and Warren. In eastern New York, Fulton, Hamilton and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1240 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Schenectady, Rotterdam, Amsterdam, Gloversville, Johnstown, Scotia, Fonda, Glenville, Duanesburg, Altamont, Broadalbin, Hagaman, Edinburg, Northville, Mayfield, Sharon Springs, Fort Johnson, Delanson, Galway and Ames. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
